meanings.definition: A group to which one does not belong.
meanings.sent1: In the school play, I was part of the outgroup that included students from the other class.
meanings.sent2: The outgroup of the club consisted of members who joined later.
meanings.sent3: At the picnic, the outgroup brought unique snacks that no one else had thought of.
meanings.sent4: The outgroup in the competition surprised everyone with their unconventional strategy.
meanings.sent5: The outgroup's flag stood out with its distinct colors and symbols.

meanings.definition: A group perceived as different or separate from one's own group.
meanings.sent1: The outgroup's traditions seemed strange to us at first.
meanings.sent2: We learned to appreciate the perspectives of the outgroup over time.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the outgroup's mascot made us all laugh with its funny dance.
meanings.sent4: The outgroup's music was like a breath of fresh air in the concert.
meanings.sent5: The outgroup's artwork showcased a whole new way of expressing creativity.
